Reviews.Title: “Bad surprise”
Reviews.Author: elisabethabib
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is quite close to the metro Repubblica in a safe area of Rome. The staff was quite helpful although we arrived at the hotel around 12pm and we still had to wait 20min for the room to be ready. We were only 2 however we were given a very big room for 4 persons. Having entered the room just after the cleaning man we expected top cleanliness. To our surprise, the room was very dirty: stains on the sheets and the moquette, dirty curtains & mould on the bathroom's walls. One window couldn't close properly and since we went to Rome during the exceptional snow weather, it let a cold airstream. The room was well equipped: soap and shampoo, 3 towels per person (clean), mini-fridge, air-conditioner (that took a while to start), hair dryer... The breakfast was quite poor. During the last hour of our trip, I lost my wallet with my ID so there was no possibility of taking the plane back to Milan. I had the idea to call the hotel since they do a photocopy of our IDs at the check-in (the flight company was ok with the photocopy). However, the staff told me that unfortunately they throw everything after check-out. No possibility for me to take back the plane: I went back in train. According to the police officer (whom I talked to because of my lost wallet) hotel staff are obliged to keep all the documentation even after check-out. I guess they got a visit from the police the next day... The hotel is more of a B&B. The building isn't only for Giotto Flavia but holds 2 or 3 other "hotels" that apparently share agreements. Breakfast is served for all the customers of these hotels at the 3rd floor of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: flothree
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in October 2011 for a long weekend, and used this hotel as our base. It's in a great location - close enough to the touristy things but far enough away to be out of the hustle and bustle. Our room was on the 6th floor and although rather spartan, was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good and kept us going for a good long while (and the coffee machine at the entrance of the room makes really nice coffee). Roses: the Receptionists were great, really friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and we didn't think it was too noisy at all, unlike other reviewers. Yes, there's traffic, but we still slept really well. We found some great restaurants close to the hotel, not only were their prices a LOT cheaper than the ones closer to the tourist attractions (as in half price) but the food and ambience were fantastic - Ristorante Il Sorriso and the pizza place literally around the corner from the hotel are highly recommended. Thorns: The hotel is in dire need of refurbishment - the reception area is shabby and the carpet in the lobby needs a good scrub/ replacing. The room we stayed in had a dripping toilet which we couldn't stop and there were stains on the walls. It's the little things like this that make such a big difference and I think if they were sorted the hotel would be a lot more lucrative - it has a lot of promise but needs TLC and a good handyman. We would consider going back because overall it was a good experience...but I'd make sure we got a room without a constantly dripping noise!

Reviews.Title: “Good City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quark233
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Oct 2011. Judging by previous reviews things have improved! Staff were polite, friendly and helpful. The room was of a very good, clean standard. Noise from road was a bit much but it is in a city centre! Lots of good restaurants within minutes of hotel. Although we did not like Annicinquanta Pizzaria Griliera

Reviews.Title: “Shame they could do more .. if only they wanted.”
Reviews.Author: loidina
Reviews.Content: All in all the experience was ok since the staff is kind and that always help. That said, the management of the hotel should really spare some cash to give rooms a fresh paint to get rid of those horrible big humidity stains on the walls. A hand of bleach here and there to deeply clean the inner part of shower doors would help too. Breakfast is average (you can't get a real cappuccino or coffee in a Rome hotel but have to use automatic machines) but again, staff is nice and smiley so you can't really blame them as it's not their choice ...

Reviews.Title: “Bed-bugs!! Decent otherwise...but... Bed-bugs.”
Reviews.Author: DocB61
Reviews.Content: The hotel realy tries to deliver a lot for the price, at least for Rome: free Wi-Fi, good breakfast included. It has a good location and though the rooms weren't great, I was actualy quite happy with the place untill I woke up to bed a bed-bug biting my neck. I caught a couple to show the front desk and they moved me to another room. That one also turned out to be infested. Management was good about moving me to another room, and laundering the cloths I had taken out of my bag when in the first room that could have been contaminated. It bugged me that they tried to stick to the story that there were only a few bugs (the ones I caught) and that I had brought them with me in my bag from my last hotel in Florence. My hotel in Florence wasn't any nicer than here, but I never woke up there with bug-bites and there were a few indications that the bed-bug infestation at this hotel wasn't new (ie. Empty shells from when bedbugs grow). I would avoid this hotel in the future. They'll need to admit they have a problem before they address it, then it will take some time. If looking for hotels in the area check the address, the building seemed to be split up by floor with at least one other hotel on one of the floors, I would steer clear of anything in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, get what you paid for, but noisy area.”
Reviews.Author: fielders
Reviews.Content: I took my mother there for her birthday, as the hotel was recommended by a friend. The room was ok, tired looking in places but seemed clean. We had new towels everyday, and the room looked like it had been cleaned but upon closer inspection (under the bed) there was evidence of dust and rubbish which was not ours! I'm not fussy with such things and believe you get what you pay for. It wasn't bad for location, 15 mins from Termini Station, and plenty of restaurants nearby which were nice and good value. It was noisy at night as the bin men came late to empty the bins directly beneath us, and you could hear the traffic mainly from the main road. Breakfast is basic, ok, does the job, nothing to get excited over! Very hot in the room though! Some of the staff seemed friendly enough. What put a dampner of things was that my mother forgot to put a necklace in the safe on our first morning there. By the time we got back from a day of sightseeing, she realised that the necklace had gone. We looked everywhere, but it was no where to be found. Sentimental value, not very expensive but still a disappointment.Was it the cleaner? Who knows? Would I visit this hotel again? NO! I'm sure there are much better hotels there and wished I paid a bit more!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare. We have been robbed there.”
Reviews.Author: marietta_kuczkowska
Reviews.Content: The stay started awful. The rooms were dirty, and old. The beds were in bad condition and sheets were yellow-dirty. Worse thing happened in the night. While we were sleeping some burglars went to our room and stole our money and jewellery. But the worst thing was that the receptionist didn't wanted to help us, he didn't call the police, and didn't tell where the police station was. Till now they didn't contact with us according insurance.

Reviews.Title: “Get a better one!”
Reviews.Author: Rina12321
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location close to central station but for fraction of the price you could probably get a better room around the area. The reception is excellent, thanks to Jacob but the rest is really struggling. The cleaner can be trusted and a nice lady! Although the sheet has not changed for 7 days. The walls need repainting and the bed is not comfortable. The window better opened as the airconditioning isnt working properly. Television only in Italian and wirings are all over the place. The safe key were missing and furnishing is really rubbish. No internet connection even when mentioned that this can be accessed at the reception or bfast area. Although they were helpful to let me use their computer when Im needing to print a boarding pass. The reception is extremely helpful..... If you are after a descent bfast avoid Giotto Flavia. The location is good in terms of restaurants. The restaurant prices are ripped off but that is a standard Rome price. 5 Euros for Coffee and Softdrinks and 3 for Water. Dont be deceived by a cheapy look of a place to eat look for their prices first before ordering. You are talking about 15-40 euros per person per meal in Rome. Bring lots of water + crisp + softdrinks + bread etc if you wish to cut cost.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Hiiamdarko
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days. Considering the price was 35 euros per night, it's very cheap. Also, staff is very polite and nice, and location is cool, near Republica and Termini station. You also have free wifi on the reception. I loved bathrooms, and I was surprised reading other reviews claiming it's noisy, cos I haven't heard any noise, and I am insomniac. The elevator sucks a bit. Oh and i dont think tv worked but who needs tv when in Rome. Other than that, i would ceirtanly come back in giotto flavia hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel!”
Reviews.Author: suesturtle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very tired (holes in the walls, scrapes on the doors where they had previously been jimmied open) - it didn't feel safe at all. The airconditioning didn't work (should have known something was wrong when we spotted the electric fan on the dresser) and there were cobwebs in the corners of the very tiny room (supposed to be a triple room). The bathroom sink plug was blocked, the TV remote didn't work and worst of all the base of the bed was broken - every time my husband or I rolled over the bed base made the most horrendous scraping sound - we were half expecting plywood splinters to start poking up through the mattress! We stayed in similarly priced hotels in other Italian cities that were far nicer, so it was not a reflection of the price.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: tmgarcia
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel as its cheap and near republica. also near the spanish steps, pantheon and shops so this is i guess its an ok accommodation in this very beautiful and historic city. quaint and antiquated elevator. the room is ok for 2 people, but the toilet is very small. friendly front desk, and they have free maps of rome available. come with breakfast, they have a coffee and chocolate drink machine, and a juicer. if you're coming from termini, make sure to alight at republicca station as its nearer. barberini is a long way to via flavia, but you get to pass a nice fountain (triton). for me this hotel is ok, should be fine for groups.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a room there for under 60 Euro its ok”
Reviews.Author: TraveledK
Reviews.Content: At a discount and all you need is a bed in the closet, it is ok. Felt like a Hostel more so than a hotel like many of these converted apartments in central Rome that have become many small hotels in the same building filled with young students. If you are one on a budget it is worth it. We opted to Switch to Medici a few doors down, (see review). It was actually cheaper, as the Medici charged for the room and not the occupancy. 60 Euro for one person is ok in the Gioto Flavia. However, 120 for two in a room that can barely accommodate one is too much. Just go to a 3 star and pay 110.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mainak
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel. May be good for single person as a couple cannot move in the room. The aircon never work and the sensor light remain on and off throughout the night so middle of night you feel someone is in your room. Lift is so fast that a pregnant woman can deliver the kid once she start journey from 6th floor to ground floor. Breakfast is hopeless and except the young man at reception all others are so rude that they dont feel to talk with you. The plus point is near to bus stops from where you can get bus to go most of the attractions. I dont recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Rome Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: TOPCATYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little too far out from St Peter's so I would suggest a hotel a little more central

Reviews.Title: “Service exceeded all expectations...and great value for the room too”
Reviews.Author: raven1nyc
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the most memorable part. In a rush to get to the train station and catch my train to Venice, I left my iPod in the room. I was without a phone for a few days, but called the hotel when I got back home to see if they had found it. Not only had they found it, but they had kept it in a safe waiting for my call. I was working with Jacob and he provided service that I simply would not expect from a 2-star hotel. After a few mishaps on my part getting a courier to pick it up, he continued to give me regular updates and finally we were able to get it delivered safely to me. Regarding the hotel itself, it's clean, comfortable, and everything you can ask for at a 2-star rating and rate. Maid service is punctual and thorough. The building is actually comprised of a number of mini-hotels, so it may be a little confusing to find the correct room at first, but it's not much of an inconvenience. As other reviews have noted, the elevator (there is only one) is a little feisty at times and the lights will go out, but it's certainly not a big deal. The breakfast is simple, but good. It's only a 10min walk from the Central Train station, but you do have to go around one large building so it's not exactly a straight shot there. All in all, great value and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: KilikinaChristine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night because it was close to Termini and we had an early trip to the airport the following day. The interior of the room was fine, but common areas were a little creepy. The entrance to the hotel almost felt unsafe at first. The reception area was dingy and dated, the elevator is extremely dirty and the lights automatically shut off when we were inside. The breakfast was probably edible but I chose not to eat because everything looked pretty packaged/processed and that's what I want to feed my body when I'm traveling in a fabulous European city. Overall, this met our needs as far as convenience, budget, and other functional aspects were concerned, but I wouldn't recommend staying here if you're looking for a charming, memorable place to wake up in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Marbett
Reviews.Content: I have found this hotel on Trip Advisor forum and was a little worried about different opinions. I made an online booking which entitled me for the 30% discount. As a result a hotel room (double), with bathroom and decent breakfast cost me per person even less than a bed in a four persons hostel room with no bathroom (68 Euro/pax). Additionally, the hotel is located very close to the center and Termini Station. It is on a rather quiet street, close to nice restaurants and little grocery and food stores. Walking distance to most of the tourist attractions. There are indeed few hotels/b&b in the same building, but it's not very hard to find the proper floor and reception. We stayed in Giotto Flavia Hotel on the 6th floor. As recommended on the forum, I asked for the room facing the street, so to have a nice bright room. The view was nice, and a balcony was a big help for very nights. The room has air-conditioning, but it was little cold the first night when we kept it on all night. I recommend cooling the room before going to bed and sleep with the balcony open. Room was ok, although looked less attractive than on the hotel webside. Simple furniture (king sixe bed, little table with tv on, two small bedside tables, one stool). Bathroom was bright and spacious. Hotel provides towels, shampoo, soap. Housemaids clean it and make bed every day. Breakfast was ok, too. There are many guests and sometimes not enough tables, especially around 9:00 - 10:00 when most of the guests come. Food was typical Italian breakfast: rolls, sweet rolls, croissants, slices of yellow cheese and salami, marmolades, cornflakes, yogurts. Tea and coffee (yes, from the machine, but not that bad), joices (also from the machine, but was too scared to try :-). Whenever anything was running out, you could always ask the girl to bring more food, so you cannot really complain about it. Receptionists were nice and helpful. What we didn't like were: 1. Very dirty (small) elevator where only two lamps (out of four) were working, including one hanging unsafely out of the ceilling. 2. Tv had only few Italian channels and not all of them working well. On the webside it is said there is satellite tv, but there was NONE. Moreover, Rome has just turned into digital tv and I doubt these tv sets are really prepared for the change. 3. The room smelled from drains. Every time when back to the room we had to open wide the balcony door (another advantage of the balcony) to get rid of the bad smell. We did complain about it, but they haven't/couldn't? help. To sum up, the hotel and rooms are little less clean and less perfect than on the website (http://www.hotelgiottoflavia.com), but the location and price are a big advantage. I would definitely recommend the hotel for trips to Rome (friends and families), especially when you plan to spend most of the time exploring the city on foot...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at giotto flavia”
Reviews.Author: jonsey_uk
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly hotel in a great location, it is only about a 10min stroll from republica and termini metro stations and a bus stop is only a couple of minutes away. Rooms were very clean and beds cormfy, bathroom a bit on the small side but good enough size. The receptionists spoke good english and were very helpful. Brekfast was not great bread, cheese, meats, croissants, some biscuit things, pastry,cereal and yoghurt but again for the priced paid it was more than adequate and you could keep going back to fill yourself up for the morning at least! I would stay here again definatley!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget stay”
Reviews.Author: suetoo
Reviews.Content: Part of Expedia Flight/Hotel package and booked 2 trips from the website also. We chose a 2 star quieter hotel away from the immediate city centre deliberately. We knew that everything would be walkable anyhow and these back and side streets of Rome are a delight. This hotel is situated off the main road and is in a typical Italian building complete with large shuttered windows. It is a very strange set up as the building appears to have a different hotel on every floor, the Giollo being on the 2nd. Glass doors into a foyer and take the lift. A small reception but the greeting from the owner (?) was warm and welcoming. Our room was average size but had a big bed, large wardrobe, very small bathroom/shower but still adequate but had a ceiling fan and air conditioning which seemed far more important than the size of the bathroom anyhow. Also wall TV and fridge. Do not expect luxury, this is 2 star here but the room was clean and cool. The breakfast room was long and narrow and the breakfasts nothing special. The juice was I am almost sure squash, there were carton yogurts, cellaphane wrapped croissants, rolls and usual jam/honey, cheese and meat. The 2 guys who seem to own the hotel, were absolutely brilliant. They advised us on how the pickpockets operate, called our tour operater when they failed to pick us up and sorted it for us, and offered general advice we found very helpful. Certainly we were able to walk to and from the sights etc easily from here. Although it obviously took us a bit longer in the heat, even a taxi wouldn't cost more than a few euro. We caught the shuttle bus direct to the hotel from the airport so I can't advise on the distance from the main train terminal, but probably not far although pulling a suitcase in the hot sun may not be advisable. The other good thing about this hotel is that there are 4 street cafes all within 50 metres and all a bit cheaper than those around the inner city. One does amazing pastries and we had evening meals at 2 others and these were both well recommended and reasonable given the current £/euro rate. There is also a local supermarket and delicatessan where we were able to buy snack bits for the room. If I went back to Rome, I would definetely use this hotel again. I does what it says on the can. 2stars, no frills, clean, budget, not far to the city, good local eateries. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Que Bella!”
Reviews.Author: prisky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adorable.! It's very close to the republica metro and most tourist attraction can reached by foot or train. For example, i walked from the hotel to the spanish steps and it took on 25 minutes. The room was very spacious with 2 doube beds, the bathroom was a decent size, enough to move around confortably. Breakfast had pastries, bread, cereal, ham, chesse, yoghurt, juice, coffee, tea. The people at reception were great and always willing to help. If I ever go back to Rome I will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: Usernametaken
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel for the budget traveler, who needs little more than a clean, private room and bathroom to come back to after a long day of running around exploring this magnificent city. If you're looking for a room with ambiance, a bathroom with luxurious fixtures and an elegantly-appointed lobby, sorry. You're going to have to pay for all that. If you would rather spend your money seeing the sights, eating, and shopping, Flavia will help you keep more of your money for the fun stuff. Added bonuses include close proximity to all the sights, safe location, breakfast included (not just "continental breakfast"; they actually have a nice little spread) and a very friendly and helpful multilingual staff. Fine, I had to climb some stairs, but I'm sure it didn't do me any harm, especially considering the amount of amazing food I ate during my three days in Rome. I feel I more than got my money's worth and will definitely stay there again the next time I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “ask for external room”
Reviews.Author: bobmoodydoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and found the location convenient and the reception staff very helpful. On our penultimate day chambermaids were cleaning a room on the other side of the corridor and we noticed the difference immediately. Rooms on the outside have daylight and were very differeent because of this feature. Our room was on the inside and had no natural light.. I accept that the external rooms may have been noisier but my advice would be to ask for a room on the outside rather than one overlooking an internal courtyard. In summary inexpensive, good location and helpful recweption.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpencive, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two persons from Denmark(late fourties) at Giotto Flavia for four days in october. The room was nice and clean, in traditional italian style. The shower was rather small (could need to be replaced)- not suitable for xx-large people. Not so much traffic noise in the area. Breakfast reasonable: coffee, tea etc., bread, youghurt. Friendly staff. Situated near Villa Borghese, Spanish steps, Via Veneto but in a not so crowded neighbourhood. Be sure to visit the local restaurant :Lampada in the nearest side-street to Via Flavia. Food (including sea-food)is excellent at very reasonable prices and the staff (and chef)very friendly and hospitable. You have to be there at 7 pm sharp or you´ll have to wait til 9.30 pm, ´course its often booked full. All in all Giotto Flavia was a good choice for us. We prefer to use money for good food rather than hotel luxury and got good value for our money at Giotto Flavia.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel the nights of June 14 & 15, The only good thing about our stay was that it was only for two nights. We checked into another hotel for the last 3 nights of our vacation. We booked this hotel through hotels.com, it was not at all what we expected. It was very dark, couldn't see even with all the lights on, the air-conditioning was actually a ceiling fan. The bathroom was very small and the shower stall is an accident waiting to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but not worth more”
Reviews.Author: Janstar
Reviews.Content: We usually choose hotels which are small and don't have too many rooms and most the time we get lucky but sometimes.......Hotel Giotto Flavia is a 2 star hotel located 1/4 mile from most major attractions in Rome which was not bad at all. This hotel is on the second floor of a 4 story building (each floor is another hotel) The entrance hall is not attractive at all (I almost changed my mind about staying there when i saw it) and you have to take a rickety elevator up to the second floor, which was out of order at least once a day. The staff was very nice. We arrived 5 hours before check-in and they checked us in anyway and on the day we left they kept our baggage for several hours. The rooms was a decent size but the lighting was horrible...very dim, especially since the only window in the room faced a small open courtyard in the middle of the building, so there was no sunshine and not much light. The room and linens were very clean, however, the bathroom was very small and only had a shower, which you had to step up 12 inches to get in to...there was some mildew in the grout, which grossed me out a bit, but i managed since we were there only 2 nights. The breakfast that was included was ok...good coffee and choices from one of the those automatic machines where you press the button for expresso, cafe latte, hot chocolate, etc... There was some cereal, rolls, cheese, ham and yogurt and some sweet buns. It was a small dining room but very clean. I would only recommend this hotel to someone who was really traveling on a budget...it cost about 150 euros, which is very, very inexpensive for a decent location in Rome. OH...VERY IMPORTANT....HOTELS IN ROME ARE NOT PERMITTED BY LAW TO HAVE IRONS SO THEY ARE NOT AVAILABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, inexpensive rooms - Great for budget traveller!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay at Giotto Flavia because of the low price. However, when we arrived, there was some construction going on so the hotel kindly relocated us to another hotel across the street. Thus, though we did not stay in the hotel, I did have a chance to see the facilities and interact with the staff. The hotel is situated in the 3rd floor of an old building. Though you enter through an old lobby, the actual hotel lobby is very clean. It is very small, and there are no bells or whistles. Just a small reception area and several rooms. The area was very clean, as were the rooms inside. Given the price of this hotel, I would recommend it for students or other low-budget travellers. It is in an area that is about a 15 min walk to the spanish steps. We felt very safe in the area and there were several restaurants and cafes nereby. Overall a good value for someone looking for a step above hostel accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nikki96
Reviews.Content: We (three 20-somethings) stayed here in Nov 2004. The hotel was a little hard to find from Termini station- the map we printed from their website wasn't the greatest- but we found it and walked there within about 10 minutes. Our room was pretty nice....very, very clean. The front desk staff was extremely helpful. Gave us plenty of advice, directions, etc. and was very pleasant in answering all of our questions. Breakfast was included and was ok, pretty much coffee and pastries and some fruit. The hotel was in a pretty busy area of town, I guess not so much a touristy area, but was about 5 min walking to the subway which we took everywhere with no problems. Only 2 subway stops away to the Vatican, and also easy to get to all other major sights. Overall we had a pleasant stay here and would stay here again.
